page.title: 13PUBLIC TRANSPORT
page.content: There is no longer a railway station in the area. The {Cromford & High Peak {Railway}used to run through from south east to north west serving the quarries but also carring pssengers. But as the quarries closed so did the railway. There were no more passengers after{1954.}Now people have to rely on the bus service. The {185}goes from{Fairfield}up to {High Peak College.}There are extra buses in the morning to take students to the college. At night there is only one bus an hour. The{192}&{733 (Trent) &{593 (Andrews)}all go up Harpur Hill Road on the way to {Chelmorton & {Monyash}7 times on weekdays.You can get to{Buxton to Hartington}on the{422 service 5 times a day and to{Millers' {Dale & Castleton}on Saturdays & Bank Holidays. Most people walk or drive.
